title: How to Install Windows 1998 on a PC

steps.title: Insert your Windows 98 installation CD in your CD-ROM.
steps.content: Insert your Windows 98 installation CD in your CD-ROM.

steps.title: Start your computer.
steps.content: Start your computer.

steps.title: Choose to "Boot from CD-ROM" and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Choose to "Boot from CD-ROM" and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Highlight "Start Windows 98 setup from CD-ROM."
steps.content: Highlight "Start Windows 98 setup from CD-ROM." and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Highlight "Configure unallocated disk space (recommended)" and press enter.
steps.content: Highlight "Configure unallocated disk space (recommended)" and press enter.

steps.title: Decide whether you want to enable large disk support.
steps.content: Decide whether you want to enable large disk support. This is all down to personal preference but "Yes, enable large disk support" was selected in this tutorial.

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Choose to "Boot from CD-ROM" and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Choose to "Boot from CD-ROM" and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Highlight "Start Windows 98 setup from CD-ROM."
steps.content: Highlight "Start Windows 98 setup from CD-ROM." and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Click "Continue".
steps.content: Click "Continue".

steps.title: Choose where you want the computer to install Windows 98 then click "Next".
steps.content: Choose where you want the computer to install Windows 98 then click "Next". It is recommended to use the directory that Windows recommends (in this case C:\\WINDOWS).

steps.title: Choose your setup options.
steps.content: Choose your setup options. This is all down to personal preference, however, "Typical" was chosen for this tutorial.

steps.title: Choose what component to install.
steps.content: Choose what component to install. "Install the most common components (Recommended)" was chosen for this tutorial but this is all down to personal preference.

steps.title: Give the computer a name and a Workgroup and click "next".
steps.content: Give the computer a name and a Workgroup and click "next". If the first two text boxes are filled, you may leave them. The "Computer Description" field is not essential for the installation.

steps.title: Choose your country from the list and click "Next".
steps.content: Choose your country from the list and click "Next".

steps.title: Click "Next"
steps.content: Click "Next"

steps.title: Restart the computer.
steps.content: Restart the computer.

steps.title: Highlight "Boot from Hard Disk" and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Highlight "Boot from Hard Disk" and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Enter your name as well as your company (not essential) and click "next".
steps.content: Enter your name as well as your company (not essential) and click "next".

steps.title: Accept the agreement and click "next".
steps.content: Accept the agreement and click "next". It's always a good idea to read the License Agreement so you know what you're signing up for.

steps.title: Enter your product key exactly and click "next".
steps.content: Enter your product key exactly and click "next".

steps.title: Click "finish".
steps.content: Click "finish".

steps.title: Highlight "Boot from Hard Disk" and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Highlight "Boot from Hard Disk" and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Set your Date/Time Properties and click "close" when finished.
steps.content: Set your Date/Time Properties and click "close" when finished.

steps.title: Restart your computer.
steps.content: Restart your computer.

steps.title: Highlight "Boot from Hard Disk" and press ↵ Enter.
steps.content: Highlight "Boot from Hard Disk" and press ↵ Enter .

steps.title: Click "Ok".
steps.content: Click "Ok".

steps.title: Windows 98 has now been installed.
steps.content: Windows 98 has now been installed.
